page.title: 18RELIGION IN WATCHET 1985
page.content: {Salvation Army-}the citadel was built in 1928 and is made of brick, it is 7m tall,17m long and 7m wide.The Army does not have a choir but they have a {Songster Brigade.}The citadel holds 125 people but only 25 go to the main service, with about the same amount of young and old people.There are 5 services a week, the main service lasting about 1 hour.By STEVEN ADAMS. {Roman Catholic-}the priest is called Rev Father W.Stonestreet.They use the {Church School Hall}which is 24 years old.The building could hold 150 people and 40 - 50 people attend except in the summer when tourists make it 100.The service has no choir, and lasts 1 hour.There are just a few more older than younger people.The collection is about Â£40 a service. By PAUL GALLAGHER
